JDT pastikan piala ketiga musim ini [METROTV]
02 Nov 2019, 23:05 by Firdaus Hashim & Syazwan Msar



JOHOR Darul Ta’zim (JDT) mengesahkan status selaku ‘raja’ bola sepak tempatan apabila muncul juara Piala Malaysia selepas mudah membenam Kedah 3-0 pada final di Stadium Nasional, Bukit Jalil, malam ini.
Tentangan sengit yang diharapkan daripada juara Piala FA, Kedah ke atas juara Liga Super, JDT jelas meleset apabila ia dikuasai sepenuhnya oleh anak buah Benjamin Mora sekali gus menghadiahkan trofi ketiga mereka musim ini selepas Piala Sumbangsih dan Liga Super.
Malah kemenangan itu juga mengulangi skrip sama dua tahun lalu apabila JDT menumbangkan Kedah 2-0 di Stadium Shah Alam untuk menjulang trofi Piala Malaysia buat kali pertama sejak penubuhan kelab itu pada 2013.
Pada perlawanan yang disaksikan 85,420 penonton itu, Mora mempertaruhkan skuad terbaik yang diketuai ketua pasukan Hariss Harun serta penjaring terbanyak Piala Malaysia ketika ini, Safawi Rasid dengan 10 gol.
Bagaimanapun, agak mengejutkan dari kem Hijau Kuning apabila tidak menyenaraikan peledak utama dari Sepanyol, Fernando Rodriguez dan tonggak berpengalaman, Azammuddin Akil di bangku simpanan.


PASUKAN JDT meraikan jaringan gol ketiga hasil jaringan Muhammad Syafiq Ahmad. FOTO Asyraf Hamzah

JDT yang beraksi pada saingan Liga Juara-Juara Asia musim ini nyata sukar digugat dan berada pada kelas tersendiri apabila menguasai permainan sejak wisel permulaan.
Tonggak pertahanan Harimau Selatan, Aidil Zafuan Radzak menghantar amaran awal pada minit keempat apabila tandukannya hampir menggegar tiang gol selepas menyambut sepakan percuma Safawi.
Serangan pertama itu jelas mengejutkan kubu Helang Merah yang kemudiannya memilih untuk bertahan menerima asakan bertali arus lawan.
Kemasukan Syafiq Ahmad bagi menggantikan Diogo Luis Santo yang mengalami kecederaan berjaya menambah sengat JDT dan akhirnya gawang Kedah dibolosi hasil jaringan Leandro Velazquez pada minit ke-26.
Safawi, 22, yang meledak hatrik ketika aksi separuh akhir kedua menentang Selangor terus memperagakan bisanya dengan mencetak nama selaku penjaring kedua menerusi sepakan percuma pada minit ke-34 yang juga gol ke-11 dalam kempen Piala Malaysia musim ini.
Memasuki babak kedua, kebangkitan yang diharapkan daripada skuad kendalian Aidil Sharin Sahak tidak kesampaian apabila JDT terus melebarkan kedudukan dengan tandukan Syafiq Ahmad pada minit ke-58.
Walaupun beberapa pertukaran dibuat dengan memasukkan dua pemain muda Fayadh Zulkifli dan Fadzrul Daniel, Kedah tetap tidak mampu merobek gawang Harimau Selatan yang dikawal rapi Farizal Marlias.

JDT to secure third trophy of the season [METROTV]
02 Nov 2019, 23:05 by Firdaus Hashim & Syazwan Msar



JOHOR Darul Ta'zim (JDT) confirmed his status as the 'king' of local football when he emerged the Malaysian Cup champion after easily defeating Kedah 3-0 in the final at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil tonight.
The fierce opposition of the Kedah FA Cup champions to the Super League champions, the JDT, was clearly missed when it was completely dominated by Benjamin Mora's men, giving them their third trophy of the season after the Contribution Cup and Super League.
The victory also repeated the same script two years ago when JDT beat Kedah 2-0 at the Shah Alam Stadium to clinch the Malaysia Cup trophy for the first time since the club's inception in 2013.
In the match, which saw 85,420 spectators, Mora risked the best squad led by team leader Hariss Harun and current Malaysian Cup scorer Safawi Rasid with 10 goals.
However, it was a bit of a shock from the Yellow Green camp when it did not list Spain's top striker Fernando Rodriguez and experienced militia Azammuddin Akil on the bench.


The JDT team celebrates Muhammad Syafiq Ahmad's third goal. PHOTO Asyraf Hamzah

The JDT, which has been playing in the Asian Champions League this season, is hard to beat and has been in its own class when dominating the game since the opening whistle.
South Tigers defender Aidil Zafuan Radzak sent an early warning in the fourth minute when his header nearly shook the goal post after Safawi's free kick.
The first attack clearly shocked the Red Eagle fortress and then chose to survive the rift.
Syafiq Ahmad's entry to replace Diogo Luis Santo who suffered an injury managed to add to the JDT's sting and eventually the Kedah goal was cleared by Leandro Velazquez's goal in the 26th minute.
Safawi, 22, who burst into a hat-trick in the second half against Selangor continued to show his composure by scoring his second goal with a free kick in the 34th minute and also his 11th goal in the Malaysian Cup campaign this season.
In the second half, the expected revival of Aidil Sharin Sahak's squad was not met as JDT continued to extend the lead with Syafiq Ahmad's header in the 58th minute.
Despite some exchanges with the introduction of two young players Fayadh Zulkifli and Fadzrul Daniel, Kedah still could not pull off a well-guarded Southern Tiger goal by Farizal Marlias.
